intro: Roubieva multifida, commonly known as the fringed roubieva, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, elongated leaves that are often deeply lobed or fringed, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Roubieva multifida is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils.
